intro: Apium nodiflorum subsp. mairei, commonly known as the Maire's cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, white to greenish flowers that bloom in umbrella-like clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. Its botanical features make it a distinctive species within its native habitat.
